japanese: 一見不運だが実は幸運なこと
example: Losing that job was actually a blessing in disguise.
Cheap souvenirs like that are a dime a dozen.
Stop beating around the bush and tell me what you want.

japanese: 遅れてもやらないよりまし
example: He finally apologized — better late than never.

japanese: 嫌なことを我慢してやる
example: I had to bite the bullet and go to the dentist.
He told a joke to break the ice at the meeting.
Let's call it a day and finish the rest tomorrow.
They cut corners when building the house, and now it’s falling apart.
Easy does it! Don’t spill the paint.
The party got out of hand when too many people showed up.
Hang in there, things will get better soon.
I'm so tired — I think I'll hit the sack.

english: let the cat out of the bag
example: She let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.
I wanted to invest in that company, but I missed the boat.
She's really on the ball with the new project.
He visits his hometown once in a blue moon.
The test was a piece of cake.
Who spilled the beans about our secret plan?

english: take it with a grain of salt
example: He exaggerates a lot, so take what he says with a grain of salt.
I'm feeling a bit under the weather today.
